Then, extrude the sketch along the Z-axis with the following properties: - Extrude Depth Towards Normal: 0.75 - Extrude Depth Opposite Normal: 0 - Sketch Scale: 0.1446 - Operation: Create a new solid body **Part 2: Cut three cylindrical holes through the prism.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: 0.0, 0.0, 180.0 - Translation Vector: 0.1001, 0.0906, 0.0 Next, create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system with the following properties: Face 1: - Loop 1: - Circle 1: Center (0.0184, 0.0184), Radius 0.0184 Face 2: - Loop 1: - Circle 1: Center (0.2754, 0.0184), Radius 0.0184 Face 3: - Loop 1: - Circle 1: Center (0.5324, 0.0184), Radius 0.0184 This sketch represents three cylinders, two larger than the third, positioned vertically and horizontally. Then, extrude the sketch along the Z-axis with the following properties: - Extrude Depth Towards Normal: 0.0459 - Extrude Depth Opposite Normal: 0.0459 - Sketch Scale: 0.5508 - Operation: Cut materials The final shape is a rectangular metal plate with three holes along its length, positioned at equal intervals. The shape has been constructed with the given instructions.</description>
